title: @meddler @riot is there anything planned for gragas?

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Gragas when played Jungle. Statistics include Gragas's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Gragas Jungle is Strong or Weak Against.

body:
While i do realize that gragas has to be kept at a somewhat low powerlevel in the context of soloq, his current state seems a bit to much to the extreme on that.

To empazise that, if you look at his plat+ winrate, he is literally the worst jungler and mid winrate wise, at 44.11 and 37.68 % winrate, respectively. (also being the second worst top at 38.92%)

Combine that with his somewhat low playrate, and he just seems... weak to me.

So, is there anything planned to help him, if even just slightly?

replies.body: We're looking at Gragas at the moment. Given how effective he is in an organized team his solo queue performance is likely to have to remain below average, he's looking noticeably below the point he should be at the moment though. Currently investigating changes for 6.3, with buffs to Q (CD, flat slow duration) and W (not sure of likely direction yet) being considered.

True, Gragas is good in premade groups and in the hands of the pros but why should he just be played as a tank jungler? After his rework he moved to the top lane and was played as an AP fighter. It was viable and also seen in the LCS until his Q got that dmg reduction to minions. Well of course, full AP Gragas shouldn't make a comeback.

http://apollo-na-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/1440257535/RIPGRAGASRIPCS.png

I would like to see the reduced minion damage get weaker by ability/champ level.

Barrel Roll: lvl1 70%, lvl2 75%, lvl3 80%, lvl4 85%, lvl5 90%

As an example.
That would possibly force him to always max Q first.
